title: Business Live: Imperial Brands boss steps down
text:
Fleming Copyright: Fleming

Fleming Agri-Products is a manufacturer of agricultural machines in Newbuildings, Northern Ireland, close to the border with the Republic.

According to Fleming's managing director Jonathan Lecky, Boris Johnson's new Brexit plan isn't good news for businesses in Northern Ireland.

“There will be customs checks as far as we can read in the document. They will be there. There’s also a question about trading - at the moment all of our customers can buy our goods without VAT and that hasn’t been discussed," he told Wake Up to Money.

"To me, it almost appears to me to be the worst of both worlds - we will have to comply with customs regulations for the Republic and customs from the UK mainland."

He added that the new plan throws up other questions, such as whether NI-based companies need to manufacture to EU standards or UK mainland standards.

"As a company you want to make things easier for yourself and your customers but with this we’re just changing things to make them worse and more difficult," he said.
